Multichannel imaging

Some articles published in 2024 reported the use QLSI with multichannel cameras, in particular with a 2-color camera [1], and a 4-polarisation camera [2]. For these implementations, 2 to 4 interferograms shall be extracted from the raw camera image.

[1]

Single-shot quantitative phase-fluorescence imaging using cross-grating wavefront microscopy, B. Marthy, M. Benefice, G. Baffou, Sci. Rep. (2024)

[2]

Capturing the Full Electromagnetic Field of Light using Polarization-Resolved Cross-Grating Wavefront Microscopy, B. Marthy, M. Benefice, G. Baffou, submitted (2024)

Multicolor imaging

If the interferogram arises from a 2-color camera, the two interferograms can be extracted using the splitColors method:

Itf0 = importItfRef(folder,MI);
Itf = Itf0.splitColors();

If the input Itf0 is a list (an array) or \(N\) Interfero objects, then the output Itf is a \(N\times2\) array of Interfero objects, where each column is one color.

Then, Itf can be processed like a normal Interfero object array using the QLSIprocess method:

IM = QLSIprocess(Itf, IL);

and just like Itf, IM is a \(N\times2\) ImageQLSI object array.

Multipolar imaging

If the interferogram arises from a 4-polarisation camera, the 4 interferograms can be extracted using the method splitPolars method:

Itf0 = importItfRef(folder,MI);
Itf = Itf0.splitPolars();

If the input Itf0 is a list (an array) or \(N\) Interfero objects, then the output Itf is a \(N\times4\) array of Interfero objects, where each column is one polarisation.

Then, Itf can be processed like a normal Interfero object using the QLSIprocess method:

IM = QLSIprocess(Itf, IL);

and just like Itf, IM is a \(N\times4\) ImageQLSI objects.

Then, the polarisation maps can be extracted using the The_CGM_polar_Method method:

polarImages = IMmulti.CGMpolar();

The output polarImages is a structure containing the fields theta0, phibar, dphi, and rgbImage. They can be displayed using:

figure,
subplot(2,2,1)
imagegb(polarImages.theta0)
set(gca,'Colormap',hsv)
title("\theta_0")
subplot(2,2,2)
imagegb(polarImages.phibar)
title("\bar\phi")
subplot(2,2,3)
imageph(polarImages.dphi)
title("\delta\phi")
subplot(2,2,4)
imagegb(polarImages.rgbImage)
colormap(gca,hsv)
fullscreen
